RepositoryMetadata.title: RepositoryMetadata
RepositoryMetadata.description: BaseModel with functionality to return the object as a yaml string.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the repository

source.title: Source
source.description: The source path (url or local) to the repository

plugin_count.title: Plugin Count
plugin_count.description: The number of plugins hosted by the repository

recipe_count.title: Recipe Count
recipe_count.description: The number of recipes hosted by the repository

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the author/maintainer person or organization.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the author/maintainer person or organization.

name.title: Name
name.description: The license name used for the package.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

url.title: Url
url.description: A URL to the license used for the package.

name.title: Name
name.description: Package name. Make it descriptive and helpful ;)

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

app_version.title: App Version
app_version.description: The version of the application code underlying the manifest

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: A list of keywords to search the package by

maintainers.title: Maintainers
maintainers.description: A list of maintainers for the package

home.title: Home
home.description: The URL of this package's home page

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: A list of URLs to source code for this project

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: A URL to an SVG or PNG image to be used as an icon

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of what this package does

Dependency.title: Dependency
Dependency.description: Configuration to fetch a Recipe or Plugin that another Recipe depends on.

kind.description: The kind of dependency. It can be a recipe or an plugin.

name.title: Name
name.description: Workflow name. This name should be unique among all the resources in your resource. Use an alias if this is not the case.

source.title: Source
source.description: URL to a repository where this resource can be found.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

hash.title: Hash
hash.description: The digest hash of the dependency when retrieved from its source. This is locked when the resource dependencies are downloaded.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: An optional alias to refer to this dependency. Useful if the name is already used somewhere else.

IOAliasHandler.title: IOAliasHandler
IOAliasHandler.description: Input and output alias handler object.

language.title: Language
language.description: Declare the language (e.g. python, csharp, etc.). This option allows the recipe to be flexible on handling different programming languages.

module.title: Module
module.description: Target module or namespace to load the alias function.

function.title: Function
function.description: Name of the function. The input value will be passed to this function as the first argument.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

index.title: Index
index.description: An integer to set the index for the order of execution. This input is only useful when there are more than one handler for the same platform and the output of one handler should be passed to another handler. This is also called chained handlers. By default all the handlers are indexed as 0 assuming they are not chained.

DAGGenericInputAlias.title: DAGGenericInputAlias
DAGGenericInputAlias.description:
Base class for DAG Alias inputs.

This class adds a handler to input to handle the process of loading the input
from different graphical interfaces.

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: Name of the client platform (e.g. Grasshopper, Revit, etc). The value can be any strings as long as it has been agreed between client-side developer and author of the recipe.

handler.title: Handler
handler.description: List of process actions to process the input or output value.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value for generic input.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

DAGStringInputAlias.title: DAGStringInputAlias
DAGStringInputAlias.description:
An Alias String input.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

DAGBooleanInputAlias.title: DAGBooleanInputAlias
DAGBooleanInputAlias.description:
The boolean type matches only two special values: True and False.

Note that values that evaluate to true or false, such as 1 and 0, are not accepted.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/boolean.html for more
information.

platform.description: Name of the client platform (e.g. Grasshopper, Revit, etc). The value can be any strings as long as it has been agreed between client-side developer and author of the recipe.

HTTP.title: HTTP
HTTP.description:
HTTP Source

A web HTTP to an FTP server or an API for example.

url.title: Url
url.description: For a HTTP endpoint this can be http://climate.onebuilding.org.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

S3.title: S3
S3.description:
S3 Source

An S3 bucket artifact Source.

key.title: Key
key.description: The path inside the bucket to source artifacts from.

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: The HTTP endpoint to reach the S3 bucket.

bucket.title: Bucket
bucket.description: The name of the S3 bucket on the host server.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

credentials_path.title: Credentials Path
credentials_path.description: Path to the file holding the AccessKey and SecretAccessKey to authenticate to the bucket. Assumes public bucket access if none are specified.

ProjectFolder.title: ProjectFolder
ProjectFolder.description:
Project Folder Source

This is the path to a folder where files and folders can be sourced. In the context
of a desktop run Workflow this folder will correspond to a local folder. In the
context of a workflow run on Pollination this folder will correspond to a Project
scoped folder.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

path.title: Path
path.description: The path to a folder where files and folders can be sourced. For a local filesystem this can be "C:\Users\me\jobs\test".

DAGFolderInputAlias.title: DAGFolderInputAlias
DAGFolderInputAlias.description:
An alias folder input.

Folder is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a folder will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
    }

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: Name of the client platform (e.g. Grasshopper, Revit, etc). The value can be any strings as long as it has been agreed between client-side developer and author of the recipe.

handler.title: Handler
handler.description: List of process actions to process the input or output value.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

DAGFileInputAlias.title: DAGFileInputAlias
DAGFileInputAlias.description:
An alias file input.

File is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a file will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    # a file with maximum 50 characters with an ``epw`` extension.

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: Name of the client platform (e.g. Grasshopper, Revit, etc). The value can be any strings as long as it has been agreed between client-side developer and author of the recipe.

handler.title: Handler
handler.description: List of process actions to process the input or output value.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

extensions.title: Extensions
extensions.description: Optional list of extensions for file. The check for extension is case-insensitive.

DAGPathInputAlias.title: DAGPathInputAlias
DAGPathInputAlias.description:
A file or a folder input.

Use this input only in cases that the input can be either a file or folder. For file
or folder-only inputs see File and Folder.

Path is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a path will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    # a file with maximum 50 characters with an ``epw`` extension.

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: Name of the client platform (e.g. Grasshopper, Revit, etc). The value can be any strings as long as it has been agreed between client-side developer and author of the recipe.

handler.title: Handler
handler.description: List of process actions to process the input or output value.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

extensions.title: Extensions
extensions.description: Optional list of extensions for path. The check for extension is case-insensitive. The extension will only be validated for file inputs.

ItemType.title: ItemType
ItemType.description:
Type enum for items in a list.

Items can not be files or folder. For a list of files you should copy them to a
folder and use FolderInput input instead of using ArrayInput.

DAGArrayInputAlias.description:

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html for
more information.

platform.description: Name of the client platform (e.g. Grasshopper, Revit, etc). The value can be any strings as long as it has been agreed between client-side developer and author of the recipe.

handler.title: Handler

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

items_type.description: Type of items in an array. All the items in an array must be from the same type.

DAGLinkedInputAlias.title: DAGLinkedInputAlias
DAGLinkedInputAlias.description:
An Alias for Linked Inputs.

A linked input alias will be hidden in the UI and will be linked to an object in 
the UI using the input handler.

        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
    }

DAGFileInput.title: DAGFileInput
DAGFileInput.description:

File is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a file will be copied

        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

DAGPathInput.title: DAGPathInput
DAGPathInput.description:
A file or a folder input.

Use this input only in cases that the input can be either a file or folder. For file
or folder-only inputs see File and Folder.

Path is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a path will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

    # a file with maximum 50 characters with an ``epw`` extension.

DAGGenericOutputAlias.title: DAGGenericOutputAlias
DAGGenericOutputAlias.description:
DAG generic alias output.

In most cases, you should not be using the generic output unless you need a dynamic
output that changes its type in different platforms because of returning different
objects in handler.

platform.title: Platform

DAGGenericOutput.description:
DAG generic output.

In most cases, you should not be using the generic output unless you need a dynamic
output that changes its type in different platforms because of returning different
objects in handler.

InputReference.title: InputReference
InputReference.description:
An input parameter reference which is not a file or a folder.

For a file or a folder use InputFileReference, InputFolderReference or
InputPathReference instead.

variable.title: Variable
variable.description: The name of the DAG input variable

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

variable.title: Variable
variable.description: The name of the looped item variable (use dot notation for nested json values)

ValueReference.title: ValueReference
ValueReference.description: A reference to a fixed value.

value.title: Value
value.description: A fixed value for this reference.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

TaskArgument.title: TaskArgument
TaskArgument.description: Task argument for receiving inputs that are not files or folders.

name.title: Name
name.description: Argument name. The name must match one of the input names from Task's template which can be a function or DAG.

from.title: From
from.description: A reference to a DAG input, a DAG output or another task output. You can also use the ValueReference type to hard-code an input value.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

variable.title: Variable
variable.description: The name of the DAG input variable

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

variable.description: The name of the DAG input variable

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

InputPathReference.title: InputPathReference
InputPathReference.description: An input file or folder reference

variable.title: Variable
variable.description: The name of the DAG input variable

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

TaskFileReference.title: TaskFileReference
TaskFileReference.description: A reference to a file that is generated in a task.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the task to pull output data from.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

TaskFolderReference.title: TaskFolderReference
TaskFolderReference.description: A reference to a folder that is generated in a task.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the task to pull output data from.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

TaskPathReference.title: TaskPathReference
TaskPathReference.description: A reference to a file or folder that is generated in a task.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the task to pull output data from.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

ValueFileReference.title: ValueFileReference
ValueFileReference.description: A reference to a fixed file.

path.title: Path
path.description: A fixed value for this reference.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

ValueFolderReference.title: ValueFolderReference
ValueFolderReference.description: A reference to a fixed folder.

path.title: Path
path.description: A fixed value for this reference.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

TaskPathArgument.title: TaskPathArgument
TaskPathArgument.description: BaseModel with functionality to return the object as a yaml string.

name.title: Name
name.description: Argument name. The name must match one of the input names from Task's template which can be a function or DAG.

from.title: From
from.description: A reference to a DAG input, a DAG output or another task output. You can also use the ValueReference type to hard-code an input value.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

sub_path.title: Sub Path
sub_path.description: A sub_path inside the path that is provided in the ``from`` field. Use sub_path to only access part of the Path that is needed instead of copying all the files and folders inside the path.

ValueListReference.title: ValueListReference
ValueListReference.description: A reference to a fixed value.

value.title: Value
value.description: A fixed value for this reference.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

DAGTaskLoop.title: DAGTaskLoop
DAGTaskLoop.description:
Loop configuration for the task.

This will run the template provided multiple times and in parallel relative to an
input or task parameter which should be a list.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

from.title: From
from.description: The task or DAG parameter to loop over (must be iterable).

TaskReturn.title: TaskReturn
TaskReturn.description: A Task return output that exposes the values from a function or a DAG.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

TaskPathReturn.title: TaskPathReturn
TaskPathReturn.description: A Task output that returns a file or a folder output from a function or a DAG.

path.title: Path
path.description: Path to the output artifact relative to where the function command is executed.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

required.title: Required
required.description: A boolean to indicate if an artifact output is required. A False value makes the artifact optional.

DAGTask.title: DAGTask
DAGTask.description: A single task in a DAG flow.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name for this task. It must be unique in a DAG.

template.title: Template
template.description: Template name. A template is a Function or a DAG. This template must be available in the dependencies.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

needs.title: Needs
needs.description: List of DAG tasks that this task depends on and needs to be executed before this task.

arguments.title: Arguments
arguments.description: The input arguments for this task.

sub_folder.title: Sub Folder
sub_folder.description: A path relative to the current folder context where artifacts should be saved. This is useful when performing a loop or invoking another workflow and wanting to save results in a specific sub_folder.

DAG.title: DAG
DAG.description: A Directed Acyclic Graph containing a list of tasks.

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique name for this dag.

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.description: Tasks are a list of DAG steps

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

outputs.title: Outputs
outputs.description: Outputs of the DAG that can be used by other DAGs.

fail_fast.title: Fail Fast
fail_fast.description: Stop scheduling new steps, as soon as it detects that one of the DAG nodes is failed. Default is True.

flow.title: Flow
flow.description: A list of tasks to create a DAG recipe.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

dependencies.title: Dependencies
dependencies.description: A list of plugins and other recipes this recipe depends on.

DockerConfig.title: DockerConfig
DockerConfig.description: Plugin Configuration to run in a Docker container

image.title: Image
image.description: Docker image name. Must include tag.

workdir.title: Workdir
workdir.description: The working directory the entrypoint command of the container runsin. This is used to determine where to load artifacts when running in the container.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

registry.title: Registry
registry.description: The container registry URLs that this container should be pulled from. Will default to Dockerhub if none is specified.

LocalConfig.title: LocalConfig
LocalConfig.description: Plugin Configuration to run on a desktop.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

PluginConfig.title: PluginConfig
PluginConfig.description:
Plugin configuration.

The config is used to schedule functions on a desktop or in other contexts
(ie: Docker).

docker.title: Docker
docker.description: The configuration to use this plugin in a docker container

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

local.title: Local
local.description: The configuration to use this plugin locally

FunctionStringInput.title: FunctionStringInput
FunctionStringInput.description:
A String input.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: A list of aliases for this input in different platforms.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

FunctionIntegerInput.title: FunctionIntegerInput
FunctionIntegerInput.description:
An integer input.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/numeric.html#numeric
for more information.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: A list of aliases for this input in different platforms.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

FunctionNumberInput.title: FunctionNumberInput
FunctionNumberInput.description:
A number input.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/numeric.html#numeric
for more information.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: A list of aliases for this input in different platforms.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

FunctionBooleanInput.title: FunctionBooleanInput
FunctionBooleanInput.description:
The boolean type matches only two special values: True and False.

Note that values that evaluate to true or false, such as 1 and 0, are not accepted.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/boolean.html for more
information.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: A list of aliases for this input in different platforms.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

FunctionFolderInput.title: FunctionFolderInput
FunctionFolderInput.description:
A folder input.

Folder is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a folder will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
    }

path.title: Path
path.description: Path to the target location that the input will be copied to.  This path is relative to the working directory where the command is executed.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: A list of aliases for this input in different platforms.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

FunctionFileInput.title: FunctionFileInput
FunctionFileInput.description:
A file input.

File is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a file will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    # a file with maximum 50 characters with an ``epw`` extension.

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

path.title: Path
path.description: Path to the target location that the input will be copied to.  This path is relative to the working directory where the command is executed.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: A list of aliases for this input in different platforms.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

extensions.title: Extensions
extensions.description: Optional list of extensions for file. The check for extension is case-insensitive.

FunctionPathInput.title: FunctionPathInput
FunctionPathInput.description:
A file or a folder input.

Use this input only in cases that the input can be either a file or folder. For file
or folder-only inputs see File and Folder.

Path is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a path will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    # a file with maximum 50 characters with an ``epw`` extension.

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

path.title: Path
path.description: Path to the target location that the input will be copied to.  This path is relative to the working directory where the command is executed.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: A list of aliases for this input in different platforms.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

extensions.title: Extensions
extensions.description: Optional list of extensions for file. The check for extension is case-insensitive.

FunctionArrayInput.title: FunctionArrayInput
FunctionArrayInput.description:
A JSON array input.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html for
more information.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: A list of aliases for this input in different platforms.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

items_type.description: Type of items in an array. All the items in an array must be from the same type.

FunctionJSONObjectInput.title: FunctionJSONObjectInput
FunctionJSONObjectInput.description:
A JSON object input.

JSON objects are similar to Python dictionaries.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/object.html for
more information.

alias.description: A list of aliases for this input in different platforms.

required.title: Required
required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

Function.title: Function
Function.description: A Function with a single or a script.

name.title: Name
name.description: Function name. Must be unique within a plugin.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

description.title: Description
description.description: Function description. A short human readable description for this function.

command.title: Command
command.description: Full shell command for this function. Each function accepts only one command. The command will be executed as a shell command in plugin. For running several commands after each other use && between the commands or pipe data from one to another using |

language.description: Programming language of the script. Currently only Python is supported.

source.title: Source
source.description: Source contains the source code of the script to execute.

Plugin.title: Plugin
Plugin.description:
A Queenbee Plugin.

A plugin contains runtime configuration for a Command Line Interface (CLI) and
a list of functions that can be executed using this CLI tool.

config.title: Config
config.description: The configuration information to run this plugin

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

PackageVersion.title: PackageVersion
PackageVersion.description:
Package Version

A MetaData object to distinguish a specific package version within a repository
index.

name.title: Name
name.description: Package name. Make it descriptive and helpful ;)

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

app_version.title: App Version
app_version.description: The version of the application code underlying the manifest

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: A list of keywords to search the package by

maintainers.title: Maintainers
maintainers.description: A list of maintainers for the package

home.title: Home
home.description: The URL of this package's home page

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: A list of URLs to source code for this project

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: A URL to an SVG or PNG image to be used as an icon

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of what this package does

slug.title: Slug
slug.description: A slug of the repository name and the package name.

kind.title: Kind
kind.description: The type of Queenbee package (ie: recipe or plugin)

readme.title: Readme
readme.description: The README file string for this package

manifest.title: Manifest
manifest.description: The package Recipe or Plugin manifest

RepositoryIndex.title: RepositoryIndex
RepositoryIndex.description: A searchable index for a Queenbee Plugin and Recipe repository

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

generated.title: Generated
generated.description: The timestamp at which the index was generated

default.description: A Queenbee package repository

plugin.title: Plugin
plugin.description: A dict of plugins accessible by name. Each name key points to a list of plugin versions

recipe.title: Recipe
recipe.description: A dict of recipes accessible by name. Each name key points to a list of recipesversions
